verses.kjv: At the end of every seven years thou shalt make a release.
verses.ct: Every 7 years, you must cancel debts.

verses.kjv: And this is the manner of the release: Every creditor that lendeth ought unto his neighbour shall release it; he shall not exact it of his neighbour, or of his brother; because it is called the LORD’s release.
verses.ct: Here is how the cancellation works: every creditor who has loaned something to a neighbor must cancel the debt. You must not demand payment from your neighbor or your fellow Israelite, because the LORD's time of debt cancellation has been declared.

verses.kjv: Of a foreigner thou mayest exact it again: but that which is thine with thy brother thine hand shall release;
verses.ct: You may still collect debts from a foreigner, but whatever your fellow Israelite owes you, you must let go.

verses.kjv: Save when there shall be no poor among you; for the LORD shall greatly bless thee in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance to possess it:
verses.ct: There should be no poor person among you, because the LORD will richly bless you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess as your inheritance—

verses.kjv: Only if thou carefully hearken unto the voice of the LORD thy God, to observe to do all these commandments which I command thee this day.
verses.ct: but only if you carefully listen to the LORD your God and make sure to follow all these commands that I am giving you today.

verses.kjv: For the LORD thy God blesseth thee, as he promised thee: and thou shalt lend unto many nations, but thou shalt not borrow; and thou shalt reign over many nations, but they shall not reign over thee.
verses.ct: The LORD your God will bless you just as he promised. You will lend to many nations but will never need to borrow. You will rule over many nations, but none of them will rule over you.

verses.kjv: If there be among you a poor man of one of thy brethren within any of thy gates in thy land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not harden thine heart, nor shut thine hand from thy poor brother:
verses.ct: If there is a poor person among your fellow Israelites in any of the towns in the land that the LORD your God is giving you, don't be hardhearted or tightfisted toward your poor brother.

verses.kjv: But thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need, in that which he wanteth.
verses.ct: Instead, be generous with him and make sure to lend him whatever he needs to meet his lack.

verses.kjv: Beware that there be not a thought in thy wicked heart, saying, The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand; and thine eye be evil against thy poor brother, and thou givest him nought; and he cry unto the LORD against thee, and it be sin unto thee.
verses.ct: Watch out that you don't think this evil thought: 'The 7th year, the year of debt cancellation, is almost here'—and then look at your poor brother with resentment and refuse to give him anything. If he cries out to the LORD against you, it will be counted as sin against you.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt surely give him, and thine heart shall not be grieved when thou givest unto him: because that for this thing the LORD thy God shall bless thee in all thy works, and in all that thou puttest thine hand unto.
verses.ct: Give to him freely, and don't resent it when you do, because the LORD your God will bless you in everything you do and in every project you undertake because of this.

verses.kjv: For the poor shall never cease out of the land: therefore I command thee, saying, Thou shalt open thine hand wide unto thy brother, to thy poor, and to thy needy, in thy land.
verses.ct: There will always be poor people in the land. That is why I am commanding you: be openhanded toward your brothers, toward the poor, and toward the needy in your land.

verses.kjv: And if thy brother, an Hebrew man, or an Hebrew woman, be sold unto thee, and serve thee six years; then in the seventh year thou shalt let him go free from thee.
verses.ct: If a fellow Hebrew—whether a man or a woman—is sold to you and serves you for 6 years, you must set that person free in the 7th year.

verses.kjv: And when thou sendest him out free from thee, thou shalt not let him go away empty:
verses.ct: When you release them, don't send them away with nothing.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt furnish him liberally out of thy flock, and out of thy floor, and out of thy winepress: of that wherewith the LORD thy God hath blessed thee thou shalt give unto him.
verses.ct: Supply them generously from your flocks, your threshing floor, and your winepress. Share with them from what the LORD your God has blessed you with.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in the land of Egypt, and the LORD thy God redeemed thee: therefore I command thee this thing to day.
verses.ct: Remember that you were once a slave in the land of Egypt, and the LORD your God set you free. That is why I am giving you this command today.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, if he say unto thee, I will not go away from thee; because he loveth thee and thine house, because he is well with thee;
verses.ct: But if the servant says to you, 'I don't want to leave you, because I love you and your family, and life with you has been good for me'—

verses.kjv: Then thou shalt take an aul, and thrust it through his ear unto the door, and he shall be thy servant for ever. And also unto thy maidservant thou shalt do likewise.
verses.ct: then take an awl and push it through his ear into the door, and he will be your servant permanently. Do the same for a female servant.

verses.kjv: It shall not seem hard unto thee, when thou sendest him away free from thee; for he hath been worth a double hired servant to thee, in serving thee six years: and the LORD thy God shall bless thee in all that thou doest.
verses.ct: Don't consider it a hardship when you set a servant free, because their 6 years of service were worth twice what you would have paid a hired worker. And the LORD your God will bless you in everything you do.

verses.kjv: All the firstling males that come of thy herd and of thy flock thou shalt sanctify unto the LORD thy God: thou shalt do no work with the firstling of thy bullock, nor shear the firstling of thy sheep.
verses.ct: Every firstborn male from your herds and flocks must be set apart for the LORD your God. Don't put a firstborn bull to work, and don't shear a firstborn sheep.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt eat it before the LORD thy God year by year in the place which the LORD shall choose, thou and thy household.
verses.ct: Each year, you and your household must eat it in the presence of the LORD your God at the place the LORD chooses.

verses.kjv: And if there be any blemish therein, as if it be lame, or blind, or have any ill blemish, thou shalt not sacrifice it unto the LORD thy God.
verses.ct: But if the animal has any defect—if it is lame, blind, or has any serious flaw—you must not sacrifice it to the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt eat it within thy gates: the unclean and the clean person shall eat it alike, as the roebuck, and as the hart.
verses.ct: Eat it in your own towns instead. Anyone, whether ceremonially clean or unclean, may eat it, just as you would eat a gazelle or a deer.

verses.kjv: Only thou shalt not eat the blood thereof; thou shalt pour it upon the ground as water.
verses.ct: Just don't consume the blood. Pour it out on the ground like water.
